data.title: Nice lunch!
data.text: Authentic Mexican food. Don't expect the typical chain Mexican food or margaritas. This is the real stuff.

data.title: Authentic
data.text: Real Mexican food not Franchise food and very reasonably priced good location I have never had anything bad there

data.title: The best tasting beef tostadas ever!
data.text: I don't know what they do to make their beef so flavorful but it really tastes good!  I have ordered them for my entire staff at my business, plus my kids and their friends.  Very nice portions and great price.  Two for only $6.  I also get some of their green sauce (salsa verde', maybe??) and put it on.  It has a little heat to it so I am careful about it, but it really adds a little "something extra" to the tostada.  The servers and the owner have always been very hospitable and the place has always been clean.  I know they remodeled it within the last year which provides for more seating.  I was there one night and they had Mariachis playing.I don't recall them selling wine and didn't check for beer.

data.title: Great Mexican Food
data.text: We eat here occasionally.  Food is good and reasonably priced, and you can tell by the number of Mexicans that patronize this restaurant that the food must be authentic.  Great Taco Salads!

data.title: Excellent
data.text:
King Burrito with steak = Delicious and generous. Everything perfect. Great tortilla. Flavourful grilled steak. Fresh onions and cilantro. Sesoned rice and cheese (queso fresco I believe )
All served with two sauces. I couldn't pick a favorite - kept alternating red, green, red, green.

data.title: Great Place, Great Price, Great Food...WIIIINNNEERRRR!!
data.text: As close as you will get to authentic in Ocala. The service is exactly as attentive as it needs to be; not as egocentric as many are accustomed to...(they are comfortable leaving you alone until you want them) Try a taco without steak or chicken or seafood in it, you'll be glad you did!

data.title: Authentic
data.text: How do you know when the food is authentic, when you see multiple Latinos eating here you just know it must be good.  Great Taco Salads probably the best in Ocala.  Other dishes are equally good.  Good refried beans.

data.title: Soooo Good!
data.text: We were referred by friends that own a resturant.  Don't let the building or Spartan decor fool you.  This was a wonderful meal.  The wait staff were friendly and attentive.  I had the chicken taco salad and my husband, the king burrito.  My salad was a wonderful surprise chunks of seasoned chunks and shredded chicken, the flavor was unbelievablely wonderful...all of the fixings were perfect. My husband ordered the king burrito. They should have called it the emperor! The accompanying ice cold beers were perfect.  Can't wait to go back...just like going home for a wonderful meal.

data.title: Eat everything
data.text: So so good, "never judge a book by its cover" doesn't look like much from outside, but wow really delicious, staff was great. There was 6 of us we ordered so much food, loved the authentic taste the service was great supper fast!

data.title: The Best
data.text: I eat eat here regularly. The best steak quesadilla I've ever had and it's consistent every time. I tell all visitors to check this place out.

data.title: Authentic
data.text: I lived in New Mexico for many years, so I am picky about my Mexican food.  This was very good.  I usually get the barbacoa or pork burrito or tacos and they are very tasty.  My partner loves the king burrito and it is HUGE.  My only negative would be the refried beans, which taste a bit pasty and bland to me.  To be fair, preparation of the beans is a regional thing, and they are just not what I am used to.

data.title: Top Mexican Food
data.text: This place is the real deal. It's is not fancy. It's not a knock-off place either. It appears to be very hardworking people who make fresh Mexican food, and as authentic as you can get in Florida. I recommend the veggie burrito, it's almost two meals and very affordable at about $6 or $7.

data.title: Mexican Lunch Spot Supreme
data.text: Nothing fancy but clean and bright this lunch spot is worth a visit. Limited menu offerings may fool you at first into thinking you are not going to find something you like. Don’t be fooled. Being in the center of Ocala’s business district across from the court buildings this place can be busy. It’s busy not because of location but because the food is that good. Generous portions of well-prepared Mexican food make this place a first choice when you are in the mood for South of the Boarder flavors at a reasonable price. Give it a try, you won’t be sorry.

data.title: Best authentic Mexican food in Ocala
data.text: This is my go to spot for authentic Mexican food. I frequent this place usually once a week for lunch. The tacos and burritos are my favorite. I tend to get steak which always comes out lean and tender, or pork which is marinated and has an awesome flavor. Sometimes I change it up and get steak and pork in my burrito at the same time! The quesadillas are also great. Service has always been good and food comes out pretty fast.

data.title: Authentic Mexican
data.text: Little casual place sitting in not exactly a prime section of town, but on the main street of 441 near town. Nothing fancy. Looks like a fast food type place. Food was great and authentic, not like the chain restaurants. Service was fast and friendly. Good pricing. Very clean place. This is not "fine dining" but neither are the box store Mexican restaurants. This one is at least more personable and better food. Would also be a good choice for pick up and take home. Will stop again while on our way up that highway.

data.title: Great fresh food, great service, great price
data.text: We had a quick, delicious lunch at Taco N Madre.  The restaurant was spotlessly clean.  When we told the waitress it was our first visit to the restaurant she was quick to explain some of the dishes to us and made excellent recommendations.  She explained that they use steak in their dishes, no ground meat.  The taco salad was probably the best I've ever had.  The steak was tender, tasty and served on top of cool, fresh lettuce with fresh tomatoes, grated cheese and sour cream.  There  was not one piece of wilted lettuce.  It was perfect!  The tacos were also very good (only using home made soft shells!).  We were so impressed that none of the dishes were oozing with taco sauce as in most Mexican restaurants.  The ingredients spoke for themselves and were delicious.  Service was excellent and quick.  Taco N Madre has become our favorite Mexican restaurant!

data.title: Just amazing
data.text: The food was great! I have traveled from Mexico to South America and the food here is right on point. A must eat!

data.title: Asada Tacos
data.text: I like to consider myself a Mexican food junkie, I was raised in San Antonio and love Mexican food.  I knew when I walked in this place we were in for a treat.   I got the chicken tostada which was nice and fresh and crunchy,  I hit the barbacoa taco which was good and the Carne asada taco which was my favorite!   Delicious flavored steak and handmade corn tortillas, this was my favorite.   Definitely will come back!   Nice laid back atmosphere.

data.title: Great!
data.text: The food is amazing and you get a lot for your money! I ordered a normal sized meal and had plenty left over for a snack later.

data.title: Server was unattendant and rude.
data.text: I came to this hole in the wall because I figured they would have authentic Mexican cuisine. They did. I gave the review 1 star because my server was awful. I had to leave my table to get my order, my refills, extra sides, and my check. The server spent more time gossiping to her co-workers than serving my table. I would recommend the food, but only for takeout because the table service is nonexistent. Ill give the place a second try and see if this experience was a fluke, but as of now the review stands.
